pullRequest.body:
We construct the equivalence between the residue field of Z_p and ZMod p in terms of the `IsLocalRing.ResidueField` declaration.

Co-authored-by: María Inés de Frutos Fernández @mariainesdff

### PR summary [770ddade06](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19922/commits/770ddade06d88fd7174cce445dca33f506cda529)

<details><summary>

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.NumberTheory.Padics.RingHoms | 1439 | 1440 | +1 (+0.07%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Padics.MahlerBasis` `Mathlib.RingTheory.WittVector.Compare` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Padics.RingHoms` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Padics.ProperSpace`</details>|1|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ residueField`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: faenuccio can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
This (`ℤ/p^nℤ`) isn't valid notation, right? I suggest using either LaTeX (as before) or using `ZMod (p ^ n)`. Same comment applies elsewhere.

The problem with LaTeX is that it is not visible in VSCode and I thought that in the doc we would like to be as close as possible to usual math. I could add "implemented as `ZMod (p ^ n)` but I would keep the unicode doc... yet, I'd be happy to adhere to community standards, so I'll do whatever you suggest @j-loreaux

pullRequest.title: feat(NumberTheory/Padics/RingHoms): add the equivalence between the residue field of Z_p and ZMod p
